## Description {#details}

An in-memory file system.

## Public Member Functions

### addFile() {#ae6eb3a5c9cf5ee7336e99374cbdea059}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::vfs::InMemoryFileSystem::addFile (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Path, time&#95;t ModificationTime, std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">llvm::MemoryBuffer</a> &gt; Buffer, std::optional&lt; uint32&#95;t &gt; User=std::nullopt, std::optional&lt; uint32&#95;t &gt; Group=std::nullopt, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a6c50be965db24d7532b6b4e6b0755f5c">llvm::sys::fs::file&#95;type</a> &gt; Type=std::nullopt, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82">llvm::sys::fs::perms</a> &gt; Perms=std::nullopt)</>}>
Add a file containing a buffer or a directory to the VFS with a path.

The VFS owns the buffer. If present, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a>, Group, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> and Perms apply to the newly-created file or directory. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the file or directory was successfully added, false if the file or directory already exists in the file system with different contents.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h/#l00574">574</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h">VirtualFileSystem.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp/#l00930">930</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp">VirtualFileSystem.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### addFileNoOwn() {#aafccb9d37b4780a41412379355a4cf41}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::vfs::InMemoryFileSystem::addFileNoOwn (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Path, time&#95;t ModificationTime, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybufferref">llvm::MemoryBufferRef</a> &amp; Buffer, std::optional&lt; uint32&#95;t &gt; User=std::nullopt, std::optional&lt; uint32&#95;t &gt; Group=std::nullopt, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#a6c50be965db24d7532b6b4e6b0755f5c">llvm::sys::fs::file&#95;type</a> &gt; Type=std::nullopt, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82">llvm::sys::fs::perms</a> &gt; Perms=std::nullopt)</>}>
Add a buffer to the VFS with a path.

The VFS does not own the buffer. If present, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a>, Group, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> and Perms apply to the newly-created file or directory. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the file or directory was successfully added, false if the file or directory already exists in the file system with different contents.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h/#l00617">617</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h">VirtualFileSystem.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp/#l00948">948</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp">VirtualFileSystem.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### addHardLink() {#a8328d3e20eac36fdb0b50d0192052c89}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::vfs::InMemoryFileSystem::addHardLink (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; NewLink, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Target)</>}>
Add a hard link to a file.

Here hard links are not intended to be fully equivalent to the classical filesystem. Both the hard link and the file share the same buffer and status (and thus have the same <a href="/docs/api/classes/uniqueid">UniqueID</a>). Because of this there is no way to distinguish between the link and the file after the link has been added.

The <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a></code> path must be an existing file or a hardlink. The <code>NewLink</code> file must not have been added before. The <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a></code> path must not be a directory. The <code>NewLink</code> node is added as a hard link which points to the resolved file of <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a></code> node. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the above condition is satisfied and hardlink was successfully created, false otherwise.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h/#l00595">595</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h">VirtualFileSystem.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp/#l01041">1041</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp">VirtualFileSystem.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### addSymbolicLink() {#ac01074de42130f7440672e8b2ba920e3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::vfs::InMemoryFileSystem::addSymbolicLink (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; NewLink, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Target, time&#95;t ModificationTime, std::optional&lt; uint32&#95;t &gt; User=std::nullopt, std::optional&lt; uint32&#95;t &gt; Group=std::nullopt, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82">llvm::sys::fs::perms</a> &gt; Perms=std::nullopt)</>}>
Add a symbolic link.

Unlike a HardLink, because <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a></code> doesn&#39;t need to refer to a file (or refer to anything, as it happens). Also, an in-memory directory for <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a></code> isn&#39;t automatically created.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h/#l00605">605</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h">VirtualFileSystem.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp/#l01060">1060</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp">VirtualFileSystem.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getRealPath() {#a29c7a2f361d2018ff1bae9ddc9d50cc1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::vfs::InMemoryFileSystem::getRealPath (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Path, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; Output)</>}>
Canonicalizes <code>Path</code> by combining with the current working directory and normalizing the path (e.g.

remove dots). If the current working directory is not set, this returns <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a59739a4f15fb2ec57a6b7fcfe938546ba8344b3d509942f035d5e303022f9b986">errc::operation&#95;not&#95;permitted</a>.

This doesn&#39;t resolve symlinks as they are not supported in in-memory file system.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h/#l00643">643</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/virtualfilesystem-h">VirtualFileSystem.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp/#l01190">1190</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/virtualfilesystem-cpp">VirtualFileSystem.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isLocal() {#a19b2edd4e88d26aea1c45ab4f7418024}

### lookupNode() {#a292966e50b9139425b890a10d6284d05}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>detail::NamedNodeOrError llvm::vfs::InMemoryFileSystem::lookupNode (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; P, bool FollowFinalSymlink, size&#95;t SymlinkDepth=0) const</>}>
Looks up the in-memory node for the path <code>P</code>.

If <code>FollowFinalSymlink</code> is true, the returned node is guaranteed to not be a symlink and its path may differ from <code>P</code>.

  labels = {["constexpr", "static"]}>
Arbitrary max depth to search through symlinks.

We can get into problems if a link links to a link that links back to the link, for example.
